intro: Cenarrhenes spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved ctenanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spathaceous inflorescence. The plant features heart-shaped, waxy leaves that are often variegated with green and white patterns. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Cenarrhenes spathulata is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
